page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: The geologyof this area makes it very valuable for wildlife. It consists of Boulder clay overlying Great Oolite Limestone. In places the limestone is close to the surface. The limestone has been quarried to provide the building stone that is so characteristic of the villages of the Upper Ouse Valley of Bedfordshire. The area isone of gently rolling countryside. There is a major belt of woodland running through the area. This belt of broadleaved woodlands is a very important landscape feature. The combination of these woodlands and the local topography makes for very attractive scenery; this area has been designated as being of Great Landscape Value in the County Structure Plan. The antiquity of these woodlands adds considerably to their importance from a wildlife viewpoint.
